# 𒁓 BUR ⋍ bowl ⇔ pour 𓈞 Brunn

𒁓 ≈ 𒉌𒌇 ≈ 𒁉 BUR ≈ beer

𒁓 BUR •bowl bur/pur pūrum “shallow bowl, platter, vessel”

𒁓 pūru bural "priest bural > bowl" 𒎎𒁓 na₄bur Napf

𒁓𒉽𒉽 BUR “bowl”

𓈞 = 𒁓 burᵒⁿ Brunn in 𒁓𒌅 bur-tu “cistern, well” 𒁓𒋢 pur-su “bowl”

𒁛 uburˢ 𒁥 ubur₂ 𒅇𒁓 u₃-bur 𒌑𒁉𒌨 u₂bi-ur uburˢ Brust a breast

𒁓𒌫 bur.ur bearer (libation-)priest

𒁓 ≈ 𒌓 in 𒌓𒋗𒈬 𒁓𒋗𒈬 par-šu-muⁿ pur-šu-mu old person

𒁓 bur part #pašāru #šuparruru separate "spread"

𒁓𒆃 bur.ka… break / cut in 𒁓𒄢 burgul stone-breaker #purkullu

𒄞 𒄠 ≈ 𒃾 𒃿 ≠ 𒁓 𒃼 par bull

𒃼 gar => 𒁓 bur
𒃼 𒐺𒎗 ≈ 𒐺𒐼 ≈ 𒁓
𒃲 ≈ 𒐺𒈨 ≠ 𒐺𒐼 𒁓

𒁓𒋢 pur-su
𒁓𒋢 (offering) bowl

𒁓𒌅 bur-tu
𒁓𒌅 cistern, well

𒁓𒄖 bur-gu •present
𒁓𒄖 (a type of offering)

𒁓𒊭𒉡 bur-ša-nu •Bursche 𓅡 ≠ 𒁓
𒁓𒊭𒉡 servant

𒁓𒋗𒈬 pur-šu-mu ⇔ παλαιός palaiós paleos 𐀞𐀨𐀍 pa-ra-jo पुराण purāṇa
𒁓𒋗𒈬 old (man, woman)

𒁓𒆰𒇻 pur-kul-lu
𒁓𒆰𒇻 lapidary, seal-cutter

𒉢𒁓𒄀𒄷 bird

𒎎 𒁓 (na₄bur) granit/litho bowl
𒂁 𒁓 (dugbur) djug 𓎡
𒍏 𒁓 (urudbur) copper bowl

𒉢𒁓𒆷 LAGAŠ Lager storehouse Akk. nakamtu (ligature) ⇔ 𒉢 •light 𓎡 Lahore

𒄷𒁓 Hubur Euphrates "watercourse" or "netherworld"

𒉢𒁓𒄀 𒄷 buru4-GI buru4-sig17 mušen "a bird"

Somehow Kara became Pura 𓉐 ⇨ Singapure Jaipur Nagpur … (kar.port ⇨ harbor?)
𒃼 gar => 𒁓 bur ⇔ pura with 5 (penta!) strokes 𒆠 𓊖 semantics NOT reflected here
